intro: Hieracium limitare, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets that are often shorter than the central disk florets. Hieracium limitare is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through rhizomes.
